paper_abstract: Whenever a functional is concave it is natural to ask whether its sendograph is a closed convex set. If so, the Hahn-Banach theory implies that the functional can be represented as the infimum of all continuous linear functionals greater than or equal to it. We refer to such representation as a dual representation. Dominated convergence of the concave integral for capacities is characterized in terms of dual representation whenever sequences of functions converge pointwise outside a set of zero capacity. paper_title: On the continuity of the concave integral
